bwwExcerpt: Director-choreographer Ashford keeps everything moving with a sharpness that's a welcome change from the flat-footedness he showed in last season's Promises, Promises. And when he lets Radcliffe break loose with a series of exhilarating dance moves in the 11 o'clock number, "Brotherhood of Man," you know that all is right with the universe. The world is a happier place to live in now that Harry Potter has found that pot of gold at the end of the Broadway rainbow.
